job_title: Registered Nurse in North Syracuse, NY
pros: Employees and management. Feels like inclusive work place
cons: Union pay scales stop at 14 year experience for RN and no compensation for over that

job_title: CD Therapist II in Syracuse, NY
pros: Early hours, home by the afternoon, great team. Amazing benefits
cons: Can be micromanaged at times

pros: Great job and place to work
cons: The in call is too much.

review_title: The only hospital to choose in Syracuse, New York
pros: Great place to work-team spirit
cons: There really are none except perhaps parking at times

pros: Fun, Family like atmosphere. Better than most big employers in area. Since of community
cons: Not for profit. Lower pay

pros: Nice staff. Good benefits raises
cons: Short staffed at times. Low pay

review_title: RN majority not supported in union environment.
pros: Health insurance plan is very good.
cons: Pay is uncompetitive with other RNs in surrounding areas. When management proposes an essential pay increase for RNs, non-RNs vote it down in this union environment. The union structure is resulting in RNs leaving for higher pay. Soon there will be no Hospital because there will be no RNs.

pros: many co workers are nice. they will find better employers too
cons: no bonuses. no extra pay. not included with all the other workers

job_title: New Graduate RN in Syracuse, NY
pros: Great culture to work for
cons: Low pay, preceptors are not consistent

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Syracuse, NY
pros: managers will be flexible and you'll get to know everyone
cons: not enough pay compared to other hospitals

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Syracuse, NY
pros: Love my coworkers, Crouse management seems to care, incentive pay for picking up shifts
cons: Low hourly pay, vaccine mandate, poor communication with staff. Expensive parking

pros: Crouse has a great family-like work atmosphere, allowing all team-members to work cohesively, no matter their practitioner level.
cons: Covid has eroded the family. More incentives need to be offered to keep valuable staff.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Syracuse, NY
pros: Such a great hospital to work at.
cons: Nurse to patient ratio could be better.

pros: Great culture learned a variety of skills to develop as a nurse
cons: Wish the pay was better.

pros: The schedule is very flexible and good benefits.
cons: Management does not stand up their employees and does not help on the unit with direct care if needed. Nurse to patient ratio is extremely unsafe.

pros: Decent pay, good benefits, flexibility, union representation
cons: Unfair work distribution, favoritism, abusive behavior allowed

pros: Independent, supportive manager, good pay and benefits
cons: Understaffed and a lot of transitions

pros: Care about staff and patients
cons: Relatively small footprint. Wish they were in more cities.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Syracuse, NY
pros: Good pay and full time work great benefits and 401 k..
cons: Not to much room to grow unless u can get your end degree

pros: Family feel Friendly staff Competitive wages
cons: Nothing bad to say about crouse

pros: Crouse is difficult and poor professionalism.
cons: Everything is wrong with the way the unit treats employees

pros: Good work environment and great schedule
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Syracuse, NY
pros: The salary is very competitive
cons: management can be very poor

job_title: Certified Diabetes Educator in Syracuse, NY
pros: competitive pay and minimal involvement from management
cons: Little room for growth in the company

pros: Very fast paced. Always busy. Great work environment.
cons: A lot of call. It can get tiring.

pros: great job and staff was great
cons: short staffed all the time

pros: Competitive salary, good benefits, fair
cons: Too many regulatory agencies interfering with patient care

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Syracuse, NY
pros: A smaller practice compared to similar businesses.
cons: Undervalued as an employee and pay is significantly lower than similar positions at other companies in the area.

pros: After bankruptcy 10 years ago, things changed drastically for the better. Non union benefits second to none. Everyone had to give their all or the place was gonna close.
cons: Upper management always following way behind the trend, hardly visible to regular employees. No longterm planning visible. Even if a 1 year plan is created it is never followed.

pros: Most employees are committed to caring for patients in the best way possible. They enjoy what they do.
cons: Past the years,  with the change of CEOs, the culture has changed dramatically.  It is not as family oriented or culture oriented as it was.  Sr. Management is reactionary.  And not approachable.

pros: Some of  the most compassionate and caring people are employed by Crouse. Always putting the patient and their families first.
cons: Job descriptions are re-written to fit the person they want to hire instead of the person fitting the job description.

pros: Caring staff, supervisor always tried to make time for you.  I was always asked "How will this work with my family", when they were thinking of any changes.
cons: Large company so you get a lot of the office politics.

review_title: Friendly people, employees are shown appreciation
job_title: HIM Assistant II in Syracuse, NY
pros: Everyone I have met at Crouse has been kind.  I really enjoy coming to work here!! Employees are appreciated; all employees were given free Lights on the Lake tickets. My hours are perfect, I get out just in time to pick my son up from afterschool childcare.
cons: None that I know of.

job_title: Emergency Care Tech in Syracuse, NY
pros: Salary and time off are per contract and good compared to other locations.  They don't reward good work due to contract.
cons: Management doesn't follow through.  Management talks about caring about employees but at the end of the day they don't..  The require you to work every other weekend in almost every department.

review_title: Ok place to work, don't be late
pros: I had amazing coworkers! They made it fun to go to work.
cons: They have a very strict late policy, you can't be even 1 minute late more than 4 times in 30 days.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Syracuse, NY
pros: Love the people I work with !  Great benefits . Room for advancement .
cons: Pay rate a little lower than other hospitials.  They do not allow CMA’ s to do everything that their license allows them.

pros:
Culture of Caring
Excellent Leadership
Progressive Team driving excellence
Transforming Healthcare in CNY!
cons:
Long hours - but worth every moment.
Lack of deep pockets to support the greater picture slows some things down. Somehow, the leadership makes it work though.

review_title: Poor management, treat people like they are disposable.
pros: Good union pay and benefits.
cons: Very poor management from the top down.

pros: There is a genuine interest in the students success. The level of effort and care that faculty put into supporting them and their curriculum is wonderful. It’s a great place to work.
cons: It’s a good place to work.

job_title: Network Engineer I in Syracuse, NY
pros: A lot of great people to work with on a day to day
cons: Upper management does not seem to care about workers.  You're either really busy or there is no work to do.

pros:
Self-employed 
Nature of business
Helpful to others 
Serving my Purpose
cons:
Building client base
Steady income uncertain
Self direction and discipline a must

pros: Crouse Hospital has the best co workers to work with.
cons: There are no cons about working at Crouse Hospital.

pros: Great benefits,  positive atmosphere, good food in the cafeteria
cons: Might get rid of your job if it will save them money

pros: Hours of operation are suitable for me. Opportunity for overtime usually.
cons: Distance , Some fellow employees hard to work with.

cons: Leadership top heavy, Union dues and parking

cons: Senior leaders not visible, opportunities limited
